content: hey crackers if you haven't seen it yet make sure to watch my DMS craft next
video number two and that shows you what kind of mats I use for this project so
if you haven't seen that yet make sure you go there and watch that first and
then come back here and see how I finished it up hey guys so I got my
standard cavern colors my gray and I'm going to use a sea sponge it's wetted
down now I've turned the other mat over and
the stone texture mat from the dungeon over and I'm using the other side now
I'm just pulling the sea sponge across the surface kind of in a random erratic
pattern because I want to mimic a natural stone type texture as opposed to
a standard kind of flagstone floor so I'm adding some other colors I had some
vert Sienna and some coffee to this to give it a little different variation in
stone texture I'm gonna use some light grey to pick out some highlights and
like I said I'm really going for just a kind of natural stone look on this so
there we go we'll let that dry and do some more and have our cavern floors now
here's a cavern system with all the elements set up and you can see it
really goes together nicely those are the mats it really looked like a natural
stone texture I have some other elements a stream sub stairs going up in some
cave cavern doors but I'll talk about those in later videos but yeah I really
like that natural look of these stone mats paradis i'm scottie roderick just
really want to thank you for making such nice layers that i can go in and kill
stuff thank you so much
